alert.note: Alert for Esmeralda; Nye (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of California and south central Nevada, including the following counties, in California, Inyo and San Bernardino. In south central Nevada, Esmeralda and Nye. * WHEN...Until 300 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated steady light to moderate rain falling across southern Nye and southern Inyo County. Minor flooding is already occurring in Death Valley National Park, and potentially along parts of the Amargosa River. - Death Valley National Park is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Panamint Springs, Darwin, Mesquite Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Trona, Scottys Castle, Amargosa Valley, Tecopa and Searles Valley. - This includes the following roads... Highway 95 in Nye County between mile markers 27 and 57. State Route 127 in Inyo County between mile markers 1 and 49. State Route 190 in Inyo County between mile markers 26 and 140. State Route 127 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 39 and 41. State Route 178 in Inyo County between mile markers 28 and 56. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
